TF025823-PHRD-CEARA-QUALITY IMPROVEMENTS

topicv3: Education Districts m1327034 2141,Education Efficiency m1327731 2135,Education Finance m1327514 498,Education m1327048 470,Education Access and Equity m1327050 2127

abstracts.cdata!:
Although primary education enrollment in
            Ceara is over 95 percent, the quality of education is poor
            as revealed by national student assessments. Dropout rates
            are a high 11 percent and completion rate is only 73
            percent. As a result of late entrance in the education
            system and repetition rates of about 10 percent, agegrade
            distortion nears 56 percent. The state's illiteracy
            rate was nearly 15 percent in 2003. The main objectives of
            the Ceara Basic Education Quality Improvement Project are to
            support the Governments goals of reducing educations low
            quality, inefficiencies and inequalities, thus improving
            human capital formation in the state and alleviating
            poverty. The main thrust of the project is basic education,
            including preschool and grades 1 through 8.
